intro: Alchornea megalophylla, commonly known as the giant-leaf alchornea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
